result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Scott Haglund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse Scott Haglund is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesse Scott Haglund was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Scott Haglund

records.addlTxt:
10:09 AM Defendant Jesse Scott Haglund in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jesse Scott Haglund.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates will amend to possession of amphetamine pursuant to 961.41(3g)(d), Count 2 will be dismissed, 12 days jail, 9 credit, time served. $50 plus costs.
Motion to amend granted. Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads no contest. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. Any remaining charges dismissed.
State makes statements regarding prior convictions. Asks court to adopt joint recommendation.
Attorney Rosenthal indicates just completed treatment. 
Court orders 12 days jail, 9 credit, time served. $50 fine plus costs, bail applied, 120 days to pay or payment plan.

9:33 AM Defendant Jesse Scott Haglund in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jesse Scott Haglund.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty.  Attorney indicates negotiations had.  Asks for status.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid permit of license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. ($200.00 Cash Bond)
No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid permit of license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. ($800.00 Signature Bond)

10:56 AM Defendant Jesse Scott Haglund in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jesse Scott Haglund.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. 
Atty Rosenthal asks to modify bail. 
State agrees with modification.
Court amends bond to $200 cash and $800 sign bond. 
Court reminds of bail/conditions. 
Set ARG 7-29-22 @9:30
Arraignment scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's demand for discovery and inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraph.. Don't operate motor vehicle without valid license or permit

1:52 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse Scott Haglund appeared by video. Ellen Craker appears  for defendant
Def- Received complaint
Att Craker- received complaint requests prelim, verifies address
State- Requests $1000 cash, No drugs or paraph. Don't drive without valid license. Lists case history with FTA's on nearly every case
Att craker- Some case overlap so not as mant FAT's. Lived at that address 2 1/2 years. Could post a couple of hundred dollars
Court- Orders $1000 cash bail, No controlled substances or paraph. Don't operate motor vehicle without valid license. Sets date
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
